calculate state of the quorum for the validation","params":{"validationHash":"- consist of hash of hashed document and timestamp"},"returns":{"_0":"number representing current participation level in percentage"}},"collectValidationResults(bytes32)":{"details":"Review the validation results","params":{"validationHash":"- consist of hash of hashed document and timestamp"},"returns":{"_0":"array  of validators","_1":"array of stakes of each validator","_2":"array of validation choices for each validator"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address,address,address,address[],uint256,address)":{"details":"Called from CohortFactory.sol by Enterprise within the cohort creation function","params":{"_auditTokenAddress":"// address of AUDT token contract","_audits":"// audit type","_enterprise":"// address of enterprise user","_members":"// address of Members contract","_validators":"// list of invited validators"}},"initializeValidation(bytes32)":{"details":"to be called by Enterprise to initiate new validation","params":{"documentHash":"- hash of unique identifier of validated transaction"}},"isValidated(bytes32)":{"details":"validators can check if specific document has been already validated by them","params":{"validationHash":"- consist of hash of hashed document and timestamp"},"returns":{"_0":"validation choices used by validator"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"returnValidators()":{"details":"returns list of validators for this cohort","returns":{"_0":"array of validators"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"updateQuorum(uint256)":{"details":"to be called by administrator to update new amount for required quorum","params":{"_requiredQuorum":"new value of required quorum"}},"validate(bytes32,uint256,uint8)":{"details":"called by validator to approve or disapprove this validation","params":{"decision":"- one of the ValidationStatus choices cast by validator","documentHash":"- hash of validated document","validationTime":"- this is the time when validation has been initialized"}}},"title":"Cohort Allows on creation of cohort by Enterprise based on invitations.  Enterprise can create cohort consisting of invited Validators. Later Enterprise can remove inactive validators and invite new ones. documentation.text:
@title Cohort
 Allows on creation of cohort by Enterprise based on invitations. 
 Enterprise can create cohort consisting of invited Validators.
 Later Enterprise can remove inactive validators and invite new ones.

attributes.value: Cohort:validate - This document has been validated already.

calculateVoteQuorum(bytes32).details: to calculate state of the quorum for the validation

params.validationHash: - consist of hash of hashed document and timestamp

returns._0: number representing current participation level in percentage

params.validationHash: - consist of hash of hashed document and timestamp

returns._1: array of stakes of each validator
returns._2: array of validation choices for each validator

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: Called from CohortFactory.sol by Enterprise within the cohort creation function

initializeValidation(bytes32).details: to be called by Enterprise to initiate new validation

params.documentHash: - hash of unique identifier of validated transaction

isValidated(bytes32).details: validators can check if specific document has been already validated by them

params.validationHash: - consist of hash of hashed document and timestamp

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

returnValidators().details: returns list of validators for this cohort

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

updateQuorum(uint256).details: to be called by administrator to update new amount for required quorum

validate(bytes32,uint256,uint8).details: called by validator to approve or disapprove this validation

params.decision: - one of the ValidationStatus choices cast by validator
params.validationTime: - this is the time when validation has been initialized

devdoc.title: Cohort Allows on creation of cohort by Enterprise based on invitations.  Enterprise can create cohort consisting of invited Validators. Later Enterprise can remove inactive validators and invite new ones.
